meanings.sent1: Seeing the abandoned puppy saddens me.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident saddens everyone in the town.
meanings.sent3: The ending of the movie saddens the audience, but they still enjoyed it.
meanings.sent4: The gray clouds in the sky seem to sadden the whole landscape.
meanings.sent5: The lonely sound of the violin playing in the distance saddens my heart.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel sorrow or grief.
meanings.sent1: The loss of a loved one deeply saddens us all.
meanings.sent2: The heartbreaking story in the book saddens the readers.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk in the fridge saddens mom, but she laughs it off.
meanings.sent4: The wilted flowers in the garden sadden the once vibrant scene.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the old man sitting alone on the bench saddens passersby.
